intro: Euodia sandwicensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian sandwicensis euodia, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and leathery, elliptical leaves. It typically grows in wet forests and is often found in shaded, moist environments. Due to its limited range and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
